title: Product Naming and Attribute Guidelines
description: Rules for the order and content of names (e.g., Category > Variety > Grade) to eliminate ambiguity in market listings.

title: Agricultural Practices and Certifications
description: Standards for recording attributes like USDA Organic, minority-owned status, or regional labels to verify supply chain claims.

title: Unit of Measure Guidelines
description: Protocols for documenting count, unit, weight, and case size to reduce variability in pack sizes across different vendors.

title: Transaction and Traceability Guidelines
description: Standards for invoices and tracking, including Invoice IDs, price per unit, and farm origin data for rapid recall response.

title: Implementing the Guidelines
description: Practical advice on how food hubs and producers can adopt these structures into their daily software and operational workflows.

title: Digital IDs
description: Unique identifiers (like GS1 Global Location Numbers) that distinguish businesses and locations in the supply chain. These act as the "social security numbers" for the food industry.

title: Lot Codes
description: Alpha/numeric codes assigned to small units of product (e.g., identifying a specific harvest date or field) to enable precision during food safety recalls and inventory management.

title: Produce - Other Resources
description: Supplemental materials, external links (USDA, GS1, PTI), and additional context for regional food systems.

title: Data Template (XLS)
description: Downloadable spreadsheet designed for maintaining business records and generating standardized invoices.

title: Full Project Report (PDF)
description: Detailed research report on collaborative standards development between IC-FOODS, USDA, and Wolfe's Neck Center.
